hard_constraints.description: Notice how high-performance graphics cards have heavy energy requirements. We must ensure that if a high-power GPU is chosen, it is never paired with a low-efficiency Bronze PSU.
Class, it is important to remember that the Xeon is a specialized processor. It strictly requires the workstation-grade C621 motherboard to function.
To maintain system stability, we must ensure the Ryzen7 processor is only ever used with the X670 motherboard; no other board is acceptable for this CPU.
Pay close attention to hardware incompatibilities: the i9 processor simply cannot be installed on an X670 motherboard, so we must forbid that combination.
For high-end workstation tasks, the Quadro card is only supported when paired with a Xeon CPU. Any other processor choice is invalid for this GPU.
The Quadro card also has motherboard limitations; specifically, it is not compatible with the Z690 board, so we must filter out that configuration.

soft_constraints.description: Finally, students, we want to find the most cost-effective build. We calculate the sum of the costs of our selected components and instruct the solver to minimize that total value.
soft_constraints.asp_rule: total_cost(Cost) :- selected_cpu(C), cpu(C, CCost), selected_gpu(G), gpu(G, GCost), selected_mobo(M), mobo(M, MCost), selected_psu(P), psu(P, PCost), Cost = CCost + GCost + MCost + PCost. #minimize { C : total_cost(C) }.
